rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.title: Vector control of filariasis in the Solomon Islands
rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.description: In Solomon Islands, filariasis is caused by the nocturnally perodic form of Wuchereria bancrofti and is transmitted by the same vectors of malaria. This study explores the control of this disease as an additional effect of the Malaria Eradication Programme.
rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.journal: Southeast Asian Journal of Tropical Medicine and Public Health
rdsi.pacelf.phase3:document.pdf_file_name: Solomon Islands/Webber 1975 SEAJTMPH Solomon Is vector control filariasis.pdf
